017package org.microbean.type;
018
019import java.util.ArrayList;
020import java.util.Collection;
021import java.util.Collections;
022import java.util.HashSet;
023import java.util.List;
024import java.util.Objects;
025
026import java.util.function.Predicate;
027
028import org.microbean.development.annotation.Convenience;
029import org.microbean.development.annotation.EntryPoint;
030import org.microbean.development.annotation.Experimental;
031import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingDiscouraged;
032import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingEncouraged;
033
034/**
035 * A value-like object representing a (Java-like) type for purposes of
036 * testing assignability.
037 *
038 * <p>Concisely: {@link Type}s represent {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
039 * java.lang.reflect.Type}s (or other frameworks' similar
040 * representations) without any dependence on {@link
041 * java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type} itself.</p>
042 *
043 * <p>This class is used directly primarily by the {@link Semantics}
044 * class and its subclasses.</p>
045 *
046 * @param <T> the type of the thing representing a Java type that is
047 * being adapted; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
048 * java.lang.reflect.Type} or some other framework's representation of
049 * one
050 *
051 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
052 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
053 *
054 * @see Semantics
055 */
056@Experimental
057public abstract class Type<T> implements Owner<T> {
058
059
060  /*
061   * Instance fields.
062   */
063
064
065  private final T type;
066
067
068  /*
069   * Constructors.
070   */
071
072
073  /**
074   * Creates a new {@link Type}.
075   *
076   * @param type the type to represent; must not be {@code null}
077   *
078   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}
079   */
080  protected Type(final T type) {
081    super();
082    this.type = Objects.requireNonNull(type, "type");
083  }
084
085
086  /*
087   * Instance methods.
088   */
089
090
091  /**
092   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
093   * a Java type that has a name.
094   *
095   * <p>In the Java reflective type system, only {@link Class} and
096   * {@link java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable} instances have names.</p>
097   *
098   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
099   * a Java type that has a name
100   *
101   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
102   * and deterministic.
103   *
104   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
105   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
106   *
107   * @see #name()
108   *
109   * @see Class#getName()
110   *
111   * @see java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable#getName()
112   */
113  @Override // Owner<T>
114  @OverridingEncouraged
115  public boolean named() {
116    return Owner.super.named();
117  }
118
119  /**
120   * Returns the name of this {@link Type} if it has one <strong>or
121   * {@code null} if it does not</strong>.
122   *
123   * <p>Only classes and type variables in the Java reflective type
124   * system have names.</p>
125   *
126   * @return the name of this {@link Type}, or {@code null}
127   *
128   * @nullability Implementations of this method may, and often will,
129   * return {@code null}.
130   *
131   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
132   * and deterministic.
133   *
134   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
135   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
136   */
137  @Override // Owner<T>
138  public abstract String name();
139
140  /**
141   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Type} represents the same
142   * type as that represented by the supplied {@link Owner}.
143   *
144   * <p>Type representation is not the same thing as equality.
145   * Specifically, a {@link Type} may represent another {@link Type}
146   * exactly, but may not be {@linkplain Type#equals(Object) equal to}
147   * it.</p>
148   *
149   * <p>Equality is <em>subordinate</em> to type representation.  That
150   * is, in determining whether a given {@link Type} represents
151   * another {@link Type}, their {@link Type#equals(Object)
152   * equals(Object)} methods may be called, but a {@link Type}'s
153   * {@link Type#equals(Object) equals(Object)} method must not call
154   * {@link #represents(Owner)}.</p>
155   *
156   * @param <X> the type representation type used by the supplied
157   * {@link Owner}
158   *
159   * @param other the {@link Owner} to test; may be {@code null} in
160   * which case {@code false} will be returned
161   *
162   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Type} represents the same
163   * type as that represented by the supplied {@link Owner}
164   *
165   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
166   * idempotent and deterministic.
167   *
168   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
169   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
170   */
171  @Override // Owner<T>
172  @OverridingEncouraged
173  public <X> boolean represents(final Owner<X> other) {
174    return Owner.super.represents(other);
175  }
176
177  /**
178   * Returns the object supplied at construction time that is the type
179   * this {@link Type} is representing.
180   *
181   * @return the object supplied at construction time that is the type
182   * this {@link Type} is representing
183   *
184   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
185   *
186   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
187   *
188   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
189   * threads.
190   */
191  @Override // Owner<T>
192  public final T object() {
193    return this.type;
194  }
195
196  /**
197   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
198   * the uppermost reference type in the type system.
199   *
200   * <p>In all practical cases, if an implementation of this method
201   * returns {@code true}, it means this {@link Type} represents
202   * {@link Object Object.class}.</p>
203   *
204   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
205   * meet these requirements.</p>
206   *
207   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
208   * the uppermost reference type in the type system, e.g. {@link
209   * Object Object.class}
210   *
211   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
212   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
213   *
214   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
215   * and deterministic.
216   */
217  public abstract boolean top();
218
219  /**
220   * If this {@link Type} represents a primitive type, and if and only
221   * if boxing is enabled in the type system being represented,
222   * returns a {@link Type} representing the corresponding "wrapper
223   * type", or this {@link Type} itself in all other cases.
224   *
225   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
226   * meet these requirements.</p>
227   *
228   * @return a {@link Type} representing the corresponding "wrapper
229   * type" where appropriate, or {@code this}
230   *
231   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
232   * {@code null}.
233   *
234   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
235   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
236   *
237   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
238   * and deterministic.
239   */
240  public abstract Type<T> box();
241
242  /**
243   * Returns an {@linkplain
244   * Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection) unmodifiable and
245   * immutable <code>Collection</code>} of the <em>direct
246   * supertypes</em> of this {@link Type}, or an {@linkplain
247   * Collection#isEmpty() empty <code>Collection</code>} if there are
248   * no direct supertypes.
249   *
250   * <p>The direct supertypes of a type are defined to be those which
251   * are described by the <a
252   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se17/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.10.2"
253   * target="_parent">Java Language Specification, section 4.10.2</a>,
254   * minus any types featuring wildcards.</p>
255   *
256   * <p>These direct supertypes of a reflective Java type may be
257   * acquired if needed via the {@link
258   * JavaTypes#directSupertypes(java.lang.reflect.Type)} method.</p>
259   *
260   * <p>The {@link Collection} returned must not contain {@code this}
261   * and must have no {@code null} or duplicate elements.</p>
262   *
263   * <p>The ordering within the returned {@link Collection} is not
264   * specified, <strong>but must be deterministic between
265   * invocations</strong>.</p>
266   *
267   * <p>The size of the {@link Collection} returned must not change
268   * between calls.</p>
269   *
270   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
271   * meet these requirements.</p>
272   *
273   * @return an {@linkplain
274   * Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection) unmodifiable and
275   * immutable <code>Collection</code>} of the <em>direct
276   * supertypes</em> of this {@link Type}; never {@code null}
277   *
278   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
279   * {@code null}.
280   *
281   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
282   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
283   *
284   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
285   * and deterministic.
286   */
287  public abstract Collection<? extends Type<T>> directSupertypes();
288
289  /**
290   * If this {@link Type} represents a parameterized type or a generic
291   * array type, returns a {@link Type} representing its raw type or
292   * generic component type, or, if this {@link Type} does not
293   * represent a parameterized type or a generic array type, returns
294   * {@code this}.
295   *
296   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
297   * meet these requirements.</p>
298   *
299   * @return a suitable {@link Type}; never {@code null}; often {@code
300   * this}
301   *
302   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
303   * {@code null}.
304   *
305   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
306   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
307   *
308   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
309   * and deterministic.
310   */
311  @Override // Owner<T>
312  public abstract Type<T> type();
313
314  /**
315   * Returns the owner of this {@link Type} as an {@link Owner
316   * Owner&lt;T&gt;}, suitable only for equality comparisons, or
317   * {@code null} if this {@link Type} is not owned.
318   *
319   * @return the owner of this {@link Type}, or {@code null}
320   *
321   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
322   * {@code null}.
323   *
324   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
325   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
326   *
327   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
328   * and deterministic.
329   */
330  @Override // Owner<T>
331  @Experimental
332  public abstract Owner<T> owner();
333
334  /**
335   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
336   * a generic class by virtue of having type parameters.
337   *
338   * <p>This implementation calls {@link Owner#hasTypeParameters()}
339   * and returns the result. Subclasses are encouraged to provide a
340   * faster implementation.</p>
341   *
342   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
343   * a generic class by virtue of having type parameters
344   *
345   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
346   * idempotent and deterministic.
347   *
348   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
349   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
350   *
351   * @see Owner#hasTypeParameters()
352   *
353   * @see #typeParameters()
354   */
355  @Override // Owner<T>
356  @OverridingEncouraged
357  public boolean hasTypeParameters() {
358    return Owner.super.hasTypeParameters();
359  }
360
361  /**
362   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
363   * a parameterized type by virtue of having type arguments.
364   *
365   * <p>This implementation calls the {@link #typeArguments()} method
366   * and returns {@code true} if the resulting {@link List}
367   * {@linkplain List#isEmpty() is not empty}.  Subclasses are
368   * encouraged to provide a faster implementation.</p>
369   *
370   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
371   * a parameterized type by virtue of having type arguments
372   *
373   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
374   * idempotent and deterministic.
375   *
376   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
377   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
378   *
379   * @see #typeArguments()
380   */
381  @OverridingEncouraged
382  public boolean hasTypeArguments() {
383    final Collection<?> tas = this.typeArguments();
384    return tas != null && !tas.isEmpty();
385  }
386
387  /**
388   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
389   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
390   * parameters.
391   *
392   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
393   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models a generic
394   * class.</p>
395   *
396   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
397   * meet these requirements.</p>
398   *
399   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
400   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
401   * parameters; never {@code null}
402   *
403   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
404   * {@code null}.
405   *
406   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
407   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
408   *
409   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
410   * and deterministic.
411   */
412  @Override // Owner<T>
413  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> typeParameters();
414
415  /**
416   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
417   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
418   * arguments.
419   *
420   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
421   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
422   * parameterized type.</p>
423   *
424   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
425   * meet these requirements.</p>
426   *
427   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
428   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
429   * parameters; never {@code null}
430   *
431   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
432   * {@code null}.
433   *
434   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
435   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
436   *
437   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
438   * and deterministic.
439   */
440  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> typeArguments();
441
442  /**
443   * Returns {@code false} when invoked since {@link Type}s don't have
444   * parameters (unlike {@link Owner}s representing {@link
445   * java.lang.reflect.Executable executables}).
446   *
447   * @return {@code false} when invoked
448   *
449   * @nullability This method always returns {@code null}.
450   *
451   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
452   *
453   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
454   * threads.
455   */
456  @Override // Owner<T>
457  public final boolean hasParameters() {
458    return false;
459  }
460
461  /**
462   * Returns {@code null} when invoked since {@link Type}s don't have
463   * parameters (unlike {@link Owner}s representing {@link
464   * java.lang.reflect.Executable executables}).
465   *
466   * @return {@code null} when invoked
467   *
468   * @nullability This method always returns {@code null}.
469   *
470   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
471   *
472   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
473   * threads.
474   */
475  @Override // Owner<T>
476  public final List<? extends Type<T>> parameters() {
477    return null;
478  }
479
480  /**
481   * Returns the <em>component type</em> of this {@link Type}, if
482   * there is one, <strong>or {@code null} if there is not</strong>.
483   *
484   * <p>Implementations of this method must return a non-{@code null}
485   * result only when this {@link Type} represents a type that is
486   * either an array or a generic array type.</p>
487   *
488   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
489   * meet these requirements.</p>
490   *
491   * @return the <em>component type</em> of this {@link Type}, if
492   * there is one, or {@code null} if there is not
493   *
494   * @nullability Implementations of this method may return {@code
495   * null}.
496   *
497   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
498   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
499   *
500   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
501   * and deterministic.
502   */
503  public abstract Type<T> componentType();
504
505  /**
506   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
507   * either a type variable or a wildcard type.
508   *
509   * <p>This implementation calls the {@link #upperBounds()} method
510   * and returns {@code true} if the resulting {@link List}
511   * {@linkplain List#isEmpty() is not empty}.  Subclasses are
512   * encouraged to provide a faster implementation.</p>
513   *
514   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an override does not
515   * meet these requirements.</p>
516   *
517   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
518   * either a type variable or a wildcard type
519   *
520   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
521   * idempotent and deterministic.
522   *
523   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
524   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
525   *
526   * @see #upperBounds()
527   */
528  @OverridingEncouraged
529  public boolean upperBounded() {
530    return !this.upperBounds().isEmpty();
531  }
532
533  /**
534   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
535   * a wildcard type with a lower bound.
536   *
537   * <p>This implementation calls the {@link #lowerBounds()} method
538   * and returns {@code true} if the resulting {@link List}
539   * {@linkplain List#isEmpty() is not empty}.  Subclasses are
540   * encouraged to provide a faster implementation.</p>
541   *
542   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an override does not
543   * meet these requirements.</p>
544   *
545   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
546   * a wildcard type with lower bounds
547   *
548   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
549   * idempotent and deterministic.
550   *
551   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
552   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
553   *
554   * @see #lowerBounds()
555   */
556  @OverridingEncouraged
557  public boolean lowerBounded() {
558    return !this.lowerBounds().isEmpty();
559  }
560
561  /**
562   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
563   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s lower
564   * bounds.
565   *
566   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
567   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
568   * lower-bounded wildcard type.</p>
569   *
570   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
571   * meet these requirements.</p>
572   *
573   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
574   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s lower
575   * bounds; never {@code null}; often {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
576   * empty}
577   *
578   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
579   * {@code null}.
580   *
581   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
582   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
583   *
584   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
585   * and deterministic.
586   */
587  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> lowerBounds();
588
589  /**
590   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
591   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s upper
592   * bounds.
593   *
594   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
595   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models either a type
596   * variable, an unbounded wildcard type, or an upper-bounded
597   * wildcard type.
598   *
599   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
600   * meet these requirements.</p>
601   *
602   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
603   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s upper
604   * bounds; never {@code null}; often {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
605   * empty}
606   *
607   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
608   * {@code null}.
609   *
610   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
611   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
612   *
613   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
614   * and deterministic.
615   */
616  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> upperBounds();
617
618  /**
619   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
620   * class.
621   *
622   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
623   * #named()} returns {@code true} and {@link #upperBounded()}
624   * returns {@code false}.</p>
625   *
626   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
627   * class
628   *
629   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
630   *
631   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
632   * threads.
633   *
634   * @see #named()
635   *
636   * @see #upperBounded()
637   */
638  public final boolean isClass() {
639    return this.named() && !this.upperBounded();
640  }
641
642  /**
643   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
644   * generic array type.
645   *
646   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
647   * #componentType()} returns a non-{@code value} and {@link #type()}
648   * returns a {@link Type} that is not {@code this}.</p>
649   *
650   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
651   * generic array type
652   *
653   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
654   *
655   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
656   * threads.
657   *
658   * @see #componentType()
659   *
660   * @see #type()
661   */
662  public final boolean genericArrayType() {
663    return this.componentType() != null && this.type() != this;
664  }
665
666  /**
667   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
668   * parameterized type.
669   *
670   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
671   * #hasTypeArguments()} returns {@code true}.</p>
672   *
673   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
674   * parameterized type
675   *
676   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
677   *
678   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
679   * threads.
680   *
681   * @see #hasTypeArguments()
682   */
683  public final boolean parameterizedType() {
684    return this.hasTypeArguments();
685  }
686
687  /**
688   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
689   * type variable.
690   *
691   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
692   * #named()} returns {@code true} and {@link #upperBounded()}
693   * returns {@code true}.</p>
694   *
695   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
696   * type variable
697   *
698   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
699   *
700   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
701   * threads.
702   *
703   * @see #named()
704   *
705   * @see #upperBounded()
706   */
707  public final boolean typeVariable() {
708    return this.named() && this.upperBounded();
709  }
710
711  /**
712   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
713   * wildcard type.
714   *
715   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
716   * #named()} returns {@code true} and one of {@link #upperBounded()}
717   * or {@link #lowerBounded()} returns {@code true}.</p>
718   *
719   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
720   * wildcard type
721   *
722   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
723   *
724   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
725   * threads.
726   *
727   * @see #named()
728   *
729   * @see #upperBounded()
730   *
731   * @see #lowerBounded()
732   */
733  public final boolean wildcard() {
734    return !this.named() && (this.upperBounded() || this.lowerBounded());
735  }
736
737  /**
738   * Returns all the supertypes of this {@link Type} (which includes
739   * this {@link Type}).
740   *
741   * <p>This method reflexively and transitively applies the direct
742   * supertype relation (represented by the {@link
743   * #directSupertypes()} method) to this {@link Type} and returns an
744   * {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection)
745   * unmodifiable <code>Collection</code>} containing the result.</p>
746   *
747   * <p>Overrides which alter this algorithm may result in undefined
748   * behavior.  Typically overriding is necessary only to refine the
749   * return type of this method.</p>
750   *
751   * @return an {@linkplain
752   * Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection) unmodifiable
753   * <code>Collection</code>} containing all the supertypes of this
754   * {@link Type} (which includes this {@link Type}); never {@code
755   * null}
756   *
757   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
758   * return {@code null}.
759   *
760   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
761   * idempotent and deterministic.
762   *
763   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
764   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
765   *
766   * @see #directSupertypes()
767   */
768  public Collection<? extends Type<T>> supertypes() {
769    final ArrayList<Type<T>> c = new ArrayList<>(11);
770    for (final Type<T> t : this.supertypes(this, null)) {
771      if (this.acceptSupertype(this, t)) {
772        c.add(t);
773      }
774    }
775    c.trimToSize();
776    return Collections.unmodifiableList(c);
777  }
778
779  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
780  private final <X> Collection<? extends Type<X>> supertypes(final Type<X> type, Predicate<? super Type<?>> unseen) {
781    if (unseen == null || unseen.test(type)) {
782      final Collection<? extends Type<X>> directSupertypes = type.directSupertypes();
783      if (directSupertypes.isEmpty()) {
784        return List.of(type); // the supertype relation is reflexive as well as transitive
785      }
786      if (unseen == null) {
787        unseen = new HashSet<>(11)::add;
788      }
789      final ArrayList<Type<X>> supertypes = new ArrayList<>(3 * directSupertypes.size() + 1);
790      supertypes.add(type); // the supertype relation is reflexive as well as transitive
791      for (final Type<X> directSupertype : directSupertypes) {
792        for (final Type<X> supertype : this.supertypes(directSupertype, unseen)) { // RECURSIVE CALL
793          supertypes.add(supertype);
794        }
795      }
796      supertypes.trimToSize();
797      return Collections.unmodifiableList(supertypes);
798    }
799    return List.of();
800  }
801
802  /**
803   * Returns {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@code
804   * supertype}, which in the normal course of events will be a {@link
805   * Type} computed by the reflexive and transitive application of the
806   * {@link #directSupertypes()} method, should be included in the
807   * return value of an invocation of the {@link #supertypes()} method
808   * that is in the process of being invoked on the supplied {@code
809   * subtype}.
810   *
811   * <p>Any other use of this method is undefined.</p>
812   *
813   * <p>The default implementation of this method returns {@code true}
814   * for all inputs.  Most subclasses will have no need to override
815   * this method.</p>
816   *
817   * <p>Overrides must not call either the {@link #directSupertypes()}
818   * or {@link #supertypes()} or {@link #supertypeOf(Type)} methods or
819   * undefined behavior, such as an infinite loop, may result.</p>
820   *
821   * @param subtype the subtype for which the supplied {@code
822   * supertype} has been determined to be a valid supertype; must not
823   * be {@code null}; is often {@code this}
824   *
825   * @param supertype the supertype to accept or reject; must not be
826   * {@code null}; may be {@code this}
827   *
828   * @return {@code true} if and only if the supplied {@link Type},
829   * which in the normal course of events will be a {@link Type}
830   * computed by the reflexive and transitive application of the
831   * {@link #directSupertypes()} method, should be included in the
832   * return value of an invocation of the {@link #supertypes()} method
833   * that is in the process of being invoked on the supplied {@code
834   * subtype}
835   *
836   * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code subtype} or
837   * {@code supertype} is {@code null}
838   *
839   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
840   * idempotent and deterministic.
841   *
842   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
843   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
844   *
845   * @see #supertypes()
846   */
847  protected boolean acceptSupertype(final Type<? extends T> subtype, final Type<? extends T> supertype) {
848    return true;
849  }
850
851  /**
852   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} is a
853   * supertype of the supplied {@link Type}.
854   *
855   * <p>This method uses a combination of the {@link #supertypes()}
856   * method and the {@link #represents(Owner)} method in its
857   * implementation.</p>
858   *
859   * @param <X> the type represented by the supplied {@link Type}
860   *
861   * @param sub the purported subtype; must not be {@code null}
862   *
863   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} is a
864   * supertype of the supplied {@link Type}
865   *
866   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code sub} is {@code null}
867   *
868   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
869   * idempotent and deterministic.
870   *
871   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
872   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
873   *
874   * @see #supertypes()
875   *
876   * @see #represents(Owner)
877   */
878  public <X> boolean supertypeOf(final Type<X> sub) {
879    final Type<T> me = this.box();
880    // Does this represent a supertype of sub?  Remember that the supertype relation is reflexive.
881    for (final Type<?> supertype : this.supertypes(sub.box(), null)) {
882      if (supertype.represents(me)) {
883        return true;
884      }
885    }
886    return false;
887  }
888
889
890  /*
891   * Inner and nested classes.
892   */
893
894
895  /**
896   * An abstract embodiment of {@link Type} {@linkplain
897   * #assignable(Type, Type) assignability rules}.
898   *
899   * <p>By default, no {@link Type} {@linkplain #assignable(Type,
900   * Type) is assignable} to any other {@link Type} except itself.
901   * Subclasses will obviously want to override this behavior in some,
902   * if not all, cases.</p>
903   *
904   * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
905   * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
906   *
907   * @see VariantSemantics
908   *
909   * @see InvariantSemantics
910   *
911   * @see CovariantSemantics
912   *
913   * @see CdiSemantics
914   */
915  @Experimental
916  public static abstract class Semantics {
917
918
919    /*
920     * Constructors.
921     */
922
923
924    /**
925     * Creates a new {@link Semantics}.
926     */
927    protected Semantics() {
928      super();
929    }
930
931
932    /*
933     * Instance methods.
934     */
935
936
937    /**
938     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
939     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
940     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
941     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
942     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using no autoboxing.
943     *
944     * <p>This is a convenience method that {@linkplain
945     * JavaType#of(java.lang.reflect.Type, boolean) creates
946     * <code>JavaType</code>s} to represent the supplied {@link
947     * java.lang.reflect.Type}s before calling the (canonical) {@link
948     * #assignable(Type, Type)} method.</p>
949     *
950     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
951     * not be {@code null}
952     *
953     * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
954     * not be {@code null}
955     *
956     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
957     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
958     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
959     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
960     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using no autoboxing;
961     * {@code false} otherwise
962     *
963     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
964     * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
965     *
966     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
967     * idempotent and deterministic.
968     *
969     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
970     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
971     *
972     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
973     *
974     * @see JavaType#of(java.lang.reflect.Type, boolean)
975     */
976    @Convenience
977    public boolean assignable(final java.lang.reflect.Type receiverType,
978                              final java.lang.reflect.Type payloadType) {
979      return this.assignable(receiverType, payloadType, false);
980    }
981
982    /**
983     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
984     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
985     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
986     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
987     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using the specified
988     * autoboxing semantics.
989     *
990     * <p>This is a convenience method that {@linkplain
991     * JavaType#of(java.lang.reflect.Type, boolean) creates
992     * <code>JavaType</code>s} to represent the supplied {@link
993     * java.lang.reflect.Type}s before calling the (canonical) {@link
994     * #assignable(Type, Type)} method.</p>
995     *
996     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
997     * not be {@code null}
998     *
999     * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
1000     * not be {@code null}
1001     *
1002     * @param box whether autoboxing is enabled
1003     *
1004     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1005     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
1006     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1007     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1008     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using the specified
1009     * autoboxing semantics; {@code false} otherwise
1010     *
1011     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
1012     * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
1013     *
1014     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1015     * idempotent and deterministic.
1016     *
1017     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1018     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1019     *
1020     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1021     *
1022     * @see JavaType#of(java.lang.reflect.Type, boolean)
1023     */
1024    @Convenience
1025    public boolean assignable(final java.lang.reflect.Type receiverType,
1026                              final java.lang.reflect.Type payloadType,
1027                              final boolean box) {
1028      return this.assignable(JavaType.of(receiverType, box), JavaType.of(payloadType, box));
1029    }
1030
1031    /**
1032     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing at
1033     * least one of the types modeled by the supplied {@code
1034     * payloadTypes} is assignable to a reference bearing the type
1035     * modeled by the supplied {@code receiverType}, according to the
1036     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance.
1037     *
1038     * <p>No autoboxing of types takes place.</p>
1039     *
1040     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
1041     * not be {@code null}
1042     *
1043     * @param payloadTypes the payload types as described above; must
1044     * not be {@code null}
1045     *
1046     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing at
1047     * least one of the types modeled by the supplied {@code
1048     * payloadTypes} is assignable to a reference bearing the type
1049     * modeled by the supplied {@code receiverType}, according to the
1050     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance;
1051     * {@code false} otherwise
1052     *
1053     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
1054     * or {@code payloadTypes} is {@code null}
1055     *
1056     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1057     * idempotent and deterministic.
1058     *
1059     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1060     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1061     *
1062     * @see #anyAssignable(java.lang.reflect.Type, Collection,
1063     * boolean)
1064     */
1065    @Convenience
1066    public final boolean anyAssignable(final java.lang.reflect.Type receiverType,
1067                                       final Collection<? extends java.lang.reflect.Type> payloadTypes) {
1068      return this.anyAssignable(receiverType, payloadTypes, false);
1069    }
1070
1071    /**
1072     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing at
1073     * least one of the types modeled by the supplied {@code
1074     * payloadTypes} is assignable to a reference bearing the type
1075     * modeled by the supplied {@code receiverType}, according to the
1076     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance.
1077     *
1078     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
1079     * not be {@code null}
1080     *
1081     * @param payloadTypes the payload types as described above; must
1082     * not be {@code null}
1083     *
1084     * @param box whether autoboxing is enabled
1085     *
1086     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing at
1087     * least one of the types modeled by the supplied {@code
1088     * payloadTypes} is assignable to a reference bearing the type
1089     * modeled by the supplied {@code receiverType}, according to the
1090     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance;
1091     * {@code false} otherwise
1092     *
1093     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
1094     * or {@code payloadTypes} is {@code null}
1095     *
1096     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1097     * idempotent and deterministic.
1098     *
1099     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1100     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1101     */
1102    @Convenience
1103    public final boolean anyAssignable(final java.lang.reflect.Type receiverType,
1104                                       final Collection<? extends java.lang.reflect.Type> payloadTypes,
1105                                       final boolean box) {
1106      final JavaType receiverJavaType = JavaType.of(receiverType, box);
1107      for (final java.lang.reflect.Type payloadType : payloadTypes) {
1108        if (this.assignable(receiverJavaType, JavaType.of(payloadType, box))) {
1109          return true;
1110        }
1111      }
1112      return false;
1113    }
1114
1115    /**
1116     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing at
1117     * least one of the types modeled by the supplied {@code
1118     * payloadTypes} is assignable to a reference bearing the type
1119     * modeled by the supplied {@code receiverType}, according to the
1120     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance.
1121     *
1122     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1123     * receiverType}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1124     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1125     *
1126     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadType};
1127     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1128     *
1129     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
1130     * not be {@code null}
1131     *
1132     * @param payloadTypes the payload types as described above; must
1133     * not be {@code null}
1134     *
1135     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing at
1136     * least one of the types modeled by the supplied {@code
1137     * payloadTypes} is assignable to a reference bearing the type
1138     * modeled by the supplied {@code receiverType}, according to the
1139     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance;
1140     * {@code false} otherwise
1141     *
1142     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
1143     * or {@code payloadTypes} is {@code null}
1144     *
1145     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1146     * idempotent and deterministic.
1147     *
1148     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1149     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1150     */
1151    @Convenience
1152    public final <X, Y> boolean anyAssignable(final Type<X> receiverType, final Collection<? extends Type<Y>> payloadTypes) {
1153      for (final Type<Y> payloadType : payloadTypes) {
1154        if (this.assignable(receiverType, payloadType)) {
1155          return true;
1156        }
1157      }
1158      return false;
1159    }
1160
1161    /**
1162     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1163     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
1164     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1165     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1166     * this {@link Semantics} instance.
1167     *
1168     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1169     * receiverType}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1170     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1171     *
1172     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadType};
1173     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1174     *
1175     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
1176     * not be {@code null}
1177     *
1178     * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
1179     * not be {@code null}
1180     *
1181     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1182     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
1183     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1184     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1185     * this {@link Semantics} instance; {@code false} otherwise
1186     *
1187     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
1188     * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
1189     *
1190     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1191     * idempotent and deterministic.
1192     *
1193     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1194     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1195     */
1196    @EntryPoint
1197    @OverridingDiscouraged
1198    public <X, Y> boolean assignable(final Type<X> receiverType, final Type<Y> payloadType) {
1199      if (receiverType == Objects.requireNonNull(payloadType, "payloadType") || receiverType.represents(payloadType)) {
1200        return true;
1201      } else if (receiverType.hasTypeArguments()) {
1202        return parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromType(receiverType, payloadType);
1203      } else if (payloadType.hasTypeArguments()) {
1204        return this.nonParameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1205      } else if (receiverType.componentType() == null) {
1206        if (receiverType.lowerBounded()) {
1207          return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, true, payloadType);
1208        } else if (receiverType.upperBounded()) {
1209          if (receiverType.named()) {
1210            return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1211          } else {
1212            return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, false, payloadType);
1213          }
1214        } else {
1215          return this.classIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1216        }
1217      } else if (receiverType.type() == receiverType) {
1218        return this.classIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1219      } else {
1220        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
1221      }
1222    }
1223
1224    private final <X, Y> boolean nonParameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverNonParameterizedType,
1225                                                                                       final Type<Y> payloadParameterizedType) {
1226      if (receiverNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
1227        if (receiverNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
1228          return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, true /* lower bounded */, payloadParameterizedType);
1229        } else if (receiverNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
1230          if (receiverNonParameterizedType.named()) {
1231            return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
1232          } else {
1233            return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, false /* upper bounded */, payloadParameterizedType);
1234          }
1235        } else {
1236          return this.classIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
1237        }
1238      } else if (receiverNonParameterizedType.type() == receiverNonParameterizedType) {
1239        return this.classIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
1240      } else {
1241        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
1242      }
1243    }
1244
1245    private final <X, Y> boolean classIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverClass,
1246                                                                           final Type<Y> payloadNonParameterizedType) {
1247      if (payloadNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
1248        if (payloadNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
1249          return this.classIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType, true);
1250        } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
1251          if (payloadNonParameterizedType.named()) {
1252            return this.classIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1253          } else {
1254            return this.classIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType, false);
1255          }
1256        } else {
1257          return this.classIsAssignableFromClass(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1258        }
1259      } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.type() == payloadNonParameterizedType) {
1260        return this.classIsAssignableFromClass(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1261      } else {
1262        return this.classIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1263      }
1264    }
1265
1266    /**
1267     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1268     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadClass} is assignable
1269     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1270     * receiverClass}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1271     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and if and only if {@code
1272     * payloadClass} models a {@linkplain Class Java class} and not
1273     * any other type, and if and only if {@code receiverClass} models
1274     * a {@linkplain Class Java class} and not any other type.
1275     *
1276     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
1277     * method.</p>
1278     *
1279     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
1280     *
1281     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1282     * receiverClass}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1283     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1284     *
1285     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadClass};
1286     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1287     *
1288     * @param receiverClass the receiver type as described above; must
1289     * not be {@code null}
1290     *
1291     * @param payloadClass the payload type as described above; must
1292     * not be {@code null}
1293     *
1294     * @return {@code false} in all cases
1295     *
1296     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1297     * idempotent and deterministic.
1298     *
1299     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1300     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1301     *
1302     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1303     */
1304    @OverridingEncouraged

1444    /**
1445     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1446     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadWildcardType} is
1447     * assignable to a reference bearing the type modeled by the
1448     * supplied {@code receiverClass}, according to the assignability
1449     * rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance, and if and
1450     * only if {@code payloadWildcardType} models a Java {@linkplain
1451     * java.lang.reflect.WildcardType wildcard type} and not any other
1452     * type, and if and only if {@code receiverClass} models a
1453     * {@linkplain Class Java class} and not any other type.
1454     *
1455     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
1456     * method.</p>
1457     *
1458     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
1459     *
1460     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1461     * receiverClass}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1462     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1463     *
1464     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadWildcardType};
1465     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1466     *
1467     * @param receiverClass the receiver type as described above; must
1468     * not be {@code null}
1469     *
1470     * @param payloadWildcardType the payload type as described above; must
1471     * not be {@code null}
1472     *
1473     * @param lowerBounded whether {@code payloadWildcardType} is a
1474     * lower-bounded wildcard type
1475     *
1476     * @return {@code false} in all cases
1477     *
1478     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1479     * idempotent and deterministic.
1480     *
1481     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1482     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1483     *
1484     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1485     */
1486    @OverridingEncouraged
1487    protected <X, Y> boolean classIsAssignableFromWildcardType(final Type<X> receiverClass, final Type<Y> payloadWildcardType, final boolean lowerBounded) {
1488      return false;
1489    }
1490
1491    private final <X, Y> boolean parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromType(final Type<X> receiverParameterizedType, final Type<Y> payloadType) {
1492      if (payloadType.hasTypeArguments()) {
1493        return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
1494      } else if (payloadType.componentType() == null) {
1495        if (payloadType.lowerBounded()) {
1496          return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType, true);
1497        } else if (payloadType.upperBounded()) {
1498          if (payloadType.named()) {
1499            return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
1500          } else {
1501            return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType, false);
1502          }
1503        } else {
1504          return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
1505        }
1506      } else if (payloadType.type() == payloadType) {
1507        return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
1508      } else {
1509        return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
1510      }
1511    }

1753    private final <X, Y> boolean genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverGenericArrayType,
1754                                                                                      final Type<Y> payloadNonParameterizedType) {
1755      if (payloadNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
1756        if (payloadNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
1757          return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType, true);
1758        } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
1759          if (payloadNonParameterizedType.named()) {
1760            return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1761          } else {
1762            return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType, false);
1763          }
1764        } else {
1765          return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1766        }
1767      } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.type() == payloadNonParameterizedType) {
1768        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1769      } else {
1770        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1771      }
1772    }

1966     * and if and only if {@code payloadWildcardType} models a Java
1967     * {@linkplain java.lang.reflect.WildcardType wildcard type} and
1968     * not any other type, and if and only if {@code
1969     * receiverGenericArrayType} models a {@linkplain
1970     * java.lang.reflect.GenericArrayType generic array type} and not
1971     * any other type.
1972     *
1973     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
1974     * method.</p>
1975     *
1976     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
1977     *

1979     * receiverGenericArrayType}; often a {@link
1980     * java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1981     *

1983     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1984     *
1985     * @param receiverGenericArrayType the receiver type as described
1986     * above; must not be {@code null}
1987     *
1988     * @param payloadWildcardType the payload type as described above; must
1989     * not be {@code null}

2006                                                                          final Type<Y> payloadWildcardType,

2010
2011    private final <X, Y> boolean typeVariableIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverTypeVariable,
2012                                                                                  final Type<Y> payloadNonParameterizedType) {
2013      if (payloadNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
2014        if (payloadNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
2015          return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType, true);
2016        } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
2017          if (payloadNonParameterizedType.named()) {
2018            return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2019          } else {
2020            return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType, false);
2021          }
2022        } else {
2023          return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromClass(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2024        }
2025      } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.type() == payloadNonParameterizedType) {
2026        return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromClass(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2027      } else {
2028        return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2029      }
2030    }

2270    private final <X, Y> boolean wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverWildcardType,
2271                                                                           final boolean lowerBounded,
2272                                                                           final Type<Y> payloadNonParameterizedType) {
2273      if (payloadNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
2274        if (payloadNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
2275          return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverWildcardType, lowerBounded, payloadNonParameterizedType, true);
2276        } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
2277          if (payloadNonParameterizedType.named()) {
2278            return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverWildcardType, lowerBounded, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2279          } else {
2280            return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverWildcardType, lowerBounded, payloadNonParameterizedType, false);
2281          }
2282        } else {
2283          return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverWildcardType, lowerBounded, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2284        }
2285      } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.type() == payloadNonParameterizedType) {
2286        return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverWildcardType, lowerBounded, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2287      } else {
2288        return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverWildcardType, lowerBounded, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2289      }
2290    }
